SEARCH
Package jdbc

Class JDBCUser

java.lang.Object
jdbc.JDBCUser
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserManager
public class JDBCUser extends Object implements UserManager
Implementation of the UserManager interface using JDBC for managing user persistence in the database. This class handles user registration, login validation (using hashed passwords), and management of the default doctor user entry. This class follows the Singleton pattern.

    • getInstance

      public static JDBCUser getInstance()
      Retrieves the single instance of the JDBCUser class (Singleton pattern).
      Returns:
      The JDBCUser instance.

    • addUser

      public int addUser(User user)
      Inserts a new user into the 'user' table after hashing the password.
      Specified by:
      addUser in interface UserManager
      Parameters:
      user - The User object to insert, containing username and plain password.
      Returns:
      The automatically generated user ID, or -1 if the insertion fails (e.g., username already exists).

    • validateLogin

      public User validateLogin(String username, String passwordPlain)
      Validates a user's login credentials by hashing the provided plain password and checking against the stored hash in the database.
      Specified by:
      validateLogin in interface UserManager
      Parameters:
      username - The username provided by the user.
      passwordPlain - The plain text password provided by the user.
      Returns:
      A partially populated User object (containing ID and username) if credentials are valid, or null otherwise.

    • insertDefaultDoctorUser

      public void insertDefaultDoctorUser(Connection conn)
      Inserts the default doctor user ("AlfredoJimenez" with password "doctor123") into the 'user' table if the user does not already exist.
      Specified by:
      insertDefaultDoctorUser in interface UserManager
      Parameters:
      conn - The active database connection.

    • getUserIdByUsernameOnlyIfExists

      public int getUserIdByUsernameOnlyIfExists(String username)
      Retrieves the user ID for a given username, primarily used to link the default doctor profile.
      Specified by:
      getUserIdByUsernameOnlyIfExists in interface UserManager
      Parameters:
      username - The username to look up.
      Returns:
      The user ID if the username exists, or -1 otherwise.
